abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column urges Pres Obama, on 150th anniversary of Juneteenth, when last American slaves were told of their freedom, to issue formal apology for United States' history of slavery; holds doing so would capitalize on significance of date to begin to ease long-simmering racial hatred that events have shown to be very much alive in United States; contends other countries and institutions have elevated themselves by issuing apologies for atrocities committed in their names, and apology for slavery could do same.
lead_paragraph: Countries, religions and corporations sometimes do awful things in their names. It doesn’t diminish them to note their failures; it elevates them.
